protocol.description: Claude Code infrastructure protocol with quality enforcement, memory persistence, and automated agent orchestration

dev-guidelines.description: Development guidelines and coding standards for consistent, maintainable code.

doc-processor.description: Process large documentation files into searchable chunks and summaries.

project-bootstrap.description: Bootstrap new projects with discovery, analysis, and initial configuration.

protocol-generator.description: Generate project-specific Claude artifacts including CLAUDE.md, agents, skills, and commands. Use after codebase analysis to create tailored protocol configuration.

memorizer.description: Persistent memory management for storing and recalling information across sessions.

quality-audit.description: Verification scripts for quality control. Use quality-control skill for full functionality.

codebase-analyzer.description: Analyze project structure, detect languages/frameworks, identify patterns and conventions. Use when initializing protocol for a new project or when asked to understand a codebase.

workflow.description: Development workflow automation for features, fixes, commits, and releases.

security-scanner.description: Scan code for security vulnerabilities including injection, auth issues, data exposure, and dependency vulnerabilities. Use before deployments, PRs, or when security audit requested.

test-coverage.description: Analyze test coverage, identify gaps, enforce thresholds, and generate test recommendations. Use before merging PRs, after writing features, or when coverage audit requested.

performance-analyzer.description: Analyze code for performance issues including algorithmic complexity, memory leaks, I/O bottlenecks, and database query problems. Use for performance-critical code or when slowness is reported.

honesty-guardrail.description: Always-active honesty protocol ensuring accurate claims and uncertainty acknowledgment.

quality-control.description: Comprehensive quality validation suite including syntax, lint, completeness, and correctness checks.

frontend-design.description: Complete frontend design workflow: research, design, implement, and validate UI components with consistency enforcement.

design-system.description: Establish, document, and enforce consistent design tokens, component patterns, and styling conventions across the codebase.

proto-help.description: List all Claude Bootstrap Protocol commands (use /help for built-in commands)

proto-init.description: Initialize Claude Bootstrap Protocol. Comprehensive setup for any project, any skill level.

fix.description: Fix a bug or issue. Usage: /fix <issue description or number>

proto-status.description: Show Claude Bootstrap Protocol state, memory status, and project health

validate.description: Validate all Claude Code hooks, skills, and infrastructure configuration

commit.description: Safely commit changes after running sanitization. Usage: /commit <message>

remember.description: Remember something for future sessions. Usage: /remember <category> <what to remember>

refactor.description: Refactor code with full quality pipeline. Invokes architects, analyzers, testers, and validators.

resume.description: Resume from a saved session state. Usage: /resume [session-id]

doc-ingest.description: Process a large documentation file into searchable chunks. Usage: /doc-ingest <path>

lint.description: Run linters on the codebase. Usage: /lint [--fix] [path]

search.description: Search the codebase. Usage: /search <query or pattern>

orchestrate.description: Coordinate multi-agent workflows with the orchestrator agent

proto-update.description: Check for and apply protocol updates with interactive approval. Usage: /proto-update [--check] [--analyze] [--auto]

bootstrap.description: Generate CLAUDE.md and project tooling. Usually called automatically by /proto-init.

doc-list.description: List all processed documentation files. Usage: /doc-list

manage-tools.description: Manage tool permissions and auto-approved tool configurations.

doc-search.description: Search processed documents for relevant sections. Usage: /doc-search <query>

recall.description: Search memory for information. Usage: /recall <topic or keyword>

feature.description: Implement a new feature. Usage: /feature <feature description>

leftoff.description: Save session state for seamless continuation. Keeps last 3 sessions. Usage: /leftoff [summary]

docs.description: Generate project documentation from code. Usage: /docs [--api] [--readme] [--all]

pr.description: Create a pull request with all checks. Usage: /pr [title]

git.description: MANDATORY pre-push checklist. MUST run before ANY git push. Usage: /git

post-write-validate.sh.description: Validates written files for syntax errors and completeness after write operations.

context-detector.sh.description: Detects file context and suggests appropriate agents based on file type and content.

research-quality-check.sh.description: Validates research quality from web fetches and searches for completeness.

stop-verify.sh.description: Final verification before stopping to ensure all quality checks pass.

file-edit-tracker.sh.description: Tracks file edits for session state and change monitoring.

run-hook.sh.description: Utility wrapper for running hooks with proper environment setup.

research-validator.sh.description: Validates research output from subagents for accuracy and completeness.

hook-logger.sh.description: Logs hook executions for debugging and monitoring.

laziness-check.sh.description: Detects placeholder code, TODOs, and incomplete implementations in Stop hook.

pre-write-check.sh.description: Blocks writes to protected directories and validates paths before file operations.

honesty-check.sh.description: Validates responses for overclaiming and ensures uncertainty is acknowledged.

agent-handoff-validator.py.description: Validates agent handoffs to ensure proper context transfer between agents.

doc-size-detector.py.description: Detects large documentation files and suggests doc-ingest for processing.

context-loader.py.description: Loads project context and checks for protocol updates on startup.

pretool-laziness-check.py.description: Blocks Write/Edit with placeholder code, TODOs, or delegation phrases.

skill-activation-prompt.py.description: Suggests relevant skills based on user prompt keywords and patterns.

dangerous-command-check.py.description: Blocks dangerous bash commands like rm -rf /, chmod 777, and piped curls.

pretool-hallucination-check.py.description: Verifies imported packages exist on PyPI/npm before allowing writes.

commit-message-validator.sh.description: Validates commit messages against protocol standards for specificity and detail.

agent-announce.py.description: Displays colored terminal banners when agents are invoked via Task tool.
